Apple___Apple_scab.description: Fungal disease causing olive-colored spots on leaves and fruit.
Apple___Apple_scab.cure: Use fungicides such as captan or mancozeb. Prune and destroy infected leaves.

Apple___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease causing dark rotting spots on apples and leaves.
Apple___Black_rot.cure: Remove infected fruit, prune infected limbs, and apply fungicide.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: Fungal disease causing yellow-orange spots on apple leaves.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.cure: Remove nearby juniper trees, apply fungicides, and plant resistant varieties.

Apple___healthy.description: No signs of disease or damage.
Apple___healthy.cure: Maintain regular watering and pruning. Monitor for early signs of disease.

Blueberry___healthy.description: Healthy blueberry leaves with no visible infections.
Blueberry___healthy.cure: Ensure good drainage and sunlight. Monitor for pests.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.description: White powdery fungal growth on leaves, common in humid areas.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.cure: Apply sulfur-based fungicides. Increase air circulation.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.description: No visible signs of infection or stress.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.cure: Ensure balanced watering and sunlight. Prune dead wood.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.description: Fungal leaf spot causing long gray lesions.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.cure: Use fungicide sprays. Practice crop rotation.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.description: Reddish-brown pustules on leaves caused by rust fungi.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.cure: Use resistant hybrids and apply fungicides.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Elongated gray-green lesions on maize leaves.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.cure: Use resistant varieties and rotate crops.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.description: Healthy maize crop with no signs of disease.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.cure: Ensure adequate nutrients and pest control.

Grape___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease causing black lesions on leaves and fruit.
Grape___Black_rot.cure: Remove infected parts and apply fungicides.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).description: Trunk disease causing leaf tiger-striping and fruit shrivel.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).cure: Prune infected wood and apply fungicides. Replant if necessary.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.description: Irregular brown spots on grape leaves.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.cure: Use fungicides and maintain good air circulation.

Grape___healthy.description: Healthy grape leaves with no disease.
Grape___healthy.cure: Practice good vineyard hygiene and proper pruning.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: Bacterial disease causing yellow shoots and misshapen fruit.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).cure: Control psyllids, remove infected trees. No known cure yet.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: Dark, water-soaked lesions on fruit and leaves.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.cure: Use copper sprays. Avoid overhead irrigation.

Peach___healthy.description: Healthy peach tree with no symptoms.
Peach___healthy.cure: Ensure proper pruning, sunlight, and pest control.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Water-soaked, dark spots on leaves and fruit.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.cure: Apply copper-based bactericides. Use resistant varieties.

Pepper,_bell___healthy.description: Bell pepper plant in good health.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.cure: Maintain proper spacing and watering practices.

Potato___Early_blight.description: Brown concentric spots on older leaves.
Potato___Early_blight.cure: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil. Rotate crops.

Potato___Late_blight.description: Dark brown lesions with pale borders caused by Phytophthora.
Potato___Late_blight.cure: Use systemic fungicides. Remove infected plants.

Potato___healthy.cure: Ensure proper watering, fertilization, and crop rotation.

Raspberry___healthy.description: No disease signs visible on raspberry plant.
Raspberry___healthy.cure: Apply mulch and maintain clean rows.

Soybean___healthy.cure: Monitor for pests. Apply foliar feed if needed.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: White fungal patches on leaves, common in dry heat.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.cure: Use sulfur-based fungicides and improve ventilation.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Purplish or reddish spots on leaves, may cause wilting and leaf drop.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.cure: Remove infected leaves, avoid overhead watering, apply fungicides if needed.

Strawberry___healthy.description: Healthy strawberry plant with vibrant green leaves.
Strawberry___healthy.cure: Keep soil moist, mulch around the base, and monitor for insects.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: Dark, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit caused by Xanthomonas.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.cure: Use copper-based bactericides. Remove and destroy infected plants.

Tomato___Early_blight.description: Dark brown leaf spots with concentric rings on older leaves.
Tomato___Early_blight.cure: Use fungicides like mancozeb or chlorothalonil. Remove infected debris.

Tomato___Late_blight.description: Greasy-looking, dark lesions caused by Phytophthora infestans.
Tomato___Late_blight.cure: Use fungicides like copper hydroxide. Remove affected plants promptly.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: Yellow spots on top and fuzzy mold on bottom of leaves.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.cure: Improve ventilation, reduce humidity, and apply sulfur fungicides.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Small circular spots with gray centers on lower leaves.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.cure: Apply fungicides and remove infected leaves.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: Tiny speckling and webbing on leaves caused by spider mites.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.cure: Spray neem oil or insecticidal soap. Increase humidity.

Tomato___Target_Spot.description: Circular brown lesions with concentric rings on tomato leaves.
Tomato___Target_Spot.cure: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil and avoid leaf wetness.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: Curling and yellowing of leaves due to virus spread by whiteflies.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.cure: Control whiteflies, remove infected plants. Use resistant varieties.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Mottled and distorted leaves caused by mosaic virus.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.cure: Remove and destroy infected plants. Disinfect tools and hands.

Tomato___healthy.description: No disease detected in tomato plant.
Tomato___healthy.cure: Maintain proper watering and fertilization. Monitor for signs of disease.
